title: Extended/ thin Tuscan face
content:
Hi all, I'm currently looking for a Tuscan typeface that's either extended or thin. All of the searches I've had only brings up standard tuscan fonts. Any suggestion/recommendations would be HIGHLY appreciated. :)

L
author: luccio

comments.content:
Maybe Corki Tuscan/rounded will work for you?:  
 [http://www.typedepot.com/corki](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.typedepot.com/corki "http://www.typedepot.com/corki")

nice! i was looking for horizontal-extended though. I may have to just rock out with a extended slab serif and add the decor to the face....was kind of hoping to stumble across a face that had those characteristics. thanks for the link.

Vertical extended. Antique Tuscan No.9, an early wood-type design by William Hamilton Page 1869 digitized by HiH Retrofonts  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/antique-tuscan-no-9/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/antique-tuscan-no-9/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/antique-tuscan-no-9/")  
Gothic Tuscan 9 by Wooden Type Fonts  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/gothic-tuscan-9/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/gothic-tuscan-9/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/gothic-tuscan-9/")  
Also a somewhat thin Tuscan, Cowboy Serenade by Font Mesa  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/cowboy-serenade/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/cowboy-serenade/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/cowboy-serenade/")  
As well as another thin wood type, Slinger by Canada Type  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/slinger/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/slinger/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/slinger/")

Don

Horizontal extended., i.e. expanded.  
LHF Fancy Full  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterheadfonts/lhf-fancy-full/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterheadfonts/lhf-fancy-full/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterheadfonts/lhf-fancy-full/")  
Thunderbird  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/thunderbird/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/thunderbird/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/thunderbird/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/thunderbird/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/thunderbird/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/thunderbird/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/thunderbird/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/thunderbird/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/thunderbird/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/thunderbird/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/thunderbird/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/thunderbird/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/thunderbird/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/thunderbird/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/thunderbird/")  
Portello  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/portello/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/portello/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/portello/")  
Pirates Gold  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/cheapprofonts/pirates-gold-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/cheapprofonts/pirates-gold-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/cheapprofonts/pirates-gold-pro/")  
Don

@Donshottype thanks man!! those are some cool references. I'm beginning to think that a thin, extended/expanded tuscan face is going to be the holy grail of my searches :P or I may have to pull out fontographer and create something. thanks a mil for the references though!
What about Bery Tuscan or is that too decorative?

You're welcome Lucious. If you are going to make a thin, extra wide Tuscan face you might start with Iza W's Bruce Double Pica from Intellecta, which is almost a monoline:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/bruce-double-pica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804085223/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/bruce-double-pica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/bruce-double-pica/")  
The digitization is somewhat rough, but nothing that can't be fixed.  
Don
